intro: Gypsacanthus, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Its fruit, which resembles a small fig, is edible and contains a sweet, sticky pulp. Gypsacanthus species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
